review.title: Noisy water waster
review.reviewText: The room was tiny, but the bathroom was large. It was not too clean, the floor hadn't been swept, the sheets and one scrawny blanket were too small for the bed. The air conditioning only worked fitfully. The staff stood outside our room and talked and smoked, so we couldn't open the window. We could hear everything in the room above us. When we returned to the hotel after a day of sightseeing, the bed was made, but the bedspread was jammed on top of the TV cabinet, the staff did not clean out the coffee pot, nor replenish the coffee, cups and stirrer packets. We only got two chintzy towels. The worst thing was that you had to run the water for at least 5 minutes before it got hot. What a waste, especially during a drought! The tub floor was sticky and had hair stuck to it. The " continental breakfast" was packaged pastries and toast. The TV reception was spotty. All together an unpleasant experience, especially for the price!
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was close to the beach and right across the street from the SF Zoo.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff need to be better trained in basic social skills. The clerk never said a word to us during check in. Better Cleaning service is needed.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the beach and to the zoo. Also, easy access to the rest of San Francisco.

review.title: Shady and expensive
review.reviewText: This hotel was loud and not very clean. The breakfast consisted of toast. There was no elevator so definitely don't bring a suitcase. When the staff came to clean the room during our stay, they also made sure to unplug everything including the fridge.

review.title: no amenities and a little outdated
review.reviewText:
We chose this hotel because I couldn't stand to pay $300+ to be downtown or by the wharf.  However, after staying here I wonder if it would have been worth the money to stay at the more expensive hotel.  
There is no lobby, no space to move around, no pool, no elevator etc.  We spent 7 days in california on a roadtrip and although this hotel was the most expensive of all of our nights, it had the worst accommodations.
review.negativeRemarks: update the bedding and enlarge the lobby and breakfast area
review.locationRemarks: Its by the zoo, and about 4 blocks from the beach, but we didn't have time in our agenda to do either of those things.

review.title: Tired hotel but clean.
review.reviewText: Rooms very cramped and tired looking. Functional rather than anything else.
review.negativeRemarks: Complete refurbish
review.locationRemarks: Good location very near MUNI

review.title: SFSU
review.reviewText: Over priced for what you get. Very basic. Not special. The breakfast is toast and coffee. Rooms are clean and decent size. If I don't need to be close to SFSU, I will not stay here

review.title: Stayed at to go to the zoo
review.reviewText: Checked in and lady who helped us was courteous but not very friendly. We stayed two nights and overall place was dirty and loud. The carpet had a wet spot and a couple of sticky spots on the and by spots I mean areas not small spots. The shower was basic but clean the bed was not very comfortable and the curtains did not eve keep the light out there was a street lamp right outside the our window that basically was shining in the room because the curtains did not seal at all on the sides. The lamps in the room were unplugged when we got there so we could not see as we entered. Did have a fridge which was nice but almost the only nice feature except being really close to the zoo. Don't think I would stay here again at any price.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean some things
review.locationRemarks: close to zoo

review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by the accommodations at Days Inn. The room was clean and tidy.

review.title: Walking distance to zoo, beach and L line.
review.reviewText:
Walking distance to zoo, beach and L line. Not much dining within walking distance. Continental breakfast is pretty terrible but there is a cafe right next door that opens at 6 am and serves good food.
Expedia price does not include tax.

review.title: Convenient location to SFSU
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located to SFSU and allowed easy accessibility to search for a home close to the campus for my daughter, who is attending the school in the Fall.
review.positiveRemarks: The parking was free and on the property.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is a bit dated, but clean and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: The zoo was right across the street and the beach was a few blocks away.

review.reviewText: Not suited for business travelers, no lobby or amenities.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, good views from front of hotel, staff somewhat friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a lot of maintenance: wallpaper peeling, carpets cleaned, breakfast area in hallway difficult to access.

review.title: Excellent location, close to the ocean
review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable. Stairs and hallways were shabby. Breakfast facilities extremely poor. No elevator but good parking. Close to public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast area and selection of items.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurant district nearby.

review.title: Days in - not too bad
review.reviewText: Love the location - Watch the sun set on the ocean just 3 short blocks from hotel.  Just acrose the street from the zoo.  A nice surprice - the Irish clutural center around the corner is an a lovely restaurant with a lively talented irish bank on Saturday nights.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff very helpful, room a nice size.  parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Radio was bad and noisey and new one was worse.
review.locationRemarks: Great coffee place next door - sandwiches and salads too.

review.title: two stars at the four star price
review.reviewText: The title says it all over price and under delivered. I have nothing more to write but it is making me do it for the review.. But hey it's in the city so life good.  Liquor store next door so I could get drunk and dream of staying at a nicer place

It was over priced for what the room looked like.  
The parking was extremely close to fit a car unless you have a compact car
The continenal breakfast was very disappointing.

review.title: Nightmare in Pacifica
review.reviewText: Music blaring until 1am. manager no help in stopping the problem
review.negativeRemarks: most everthing

review.title: Good hotel close to the beach and zoo
review.reviewText: The hotel was decent and comfortable.  It was a good night sleep and the price was incredible for San Francisco.  The breakfast was meager and lacked choices.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: My title says it all. Steps to surfing OB and a good pizzeria next door.

review.title: Great place for the cost!
review.reviewText: This hotel is easy to find at the end of Sloat Avenue.  Very close to Ocean Beach and a very short drive to the wonderful Cliff House Restaurant.  Free parking!  This is a basic hotel with  free breakfast of apples, oranges, juices, coffee, English Muffin or pastry.
review.positiveRemarks: Check in is at 2:00.  Free parking is good but close for my full size vehicle.  The room was clean and I did not hear street noise in my room.
review.negativeRemarks: Some furnishings are ready to be updated.
review.locationRemarks: This place is right near the ZOO and just blocks from the ocean.

review.reviewText: Front desk attendant was super friendly when checking me in. The room was clean, but felt a little bit dirty because of dinginess. Bed was decent and there was free wifi.
review.positiveRemarks: Its location. Free parking. Large bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Room is dated and could definitely use some paint.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the beach. Close to the zoo.

review.reviewText: Staff friendly and helpful, If not familiar with public transportation it is hard to get around. Taxi very expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: fix walls under windows. Windows were filthy. Gigantic hairball in bathroom. Better breakfasts.
review.locationRemarks: Close to zoo. Very far from other attractions.

review.title: out of the action but good choice
review.reviewText:
wanted to stay away from the downtown and have easy access to the airport the next morning.   this hotel was more than expected, very nice rooms and very pleasant and accommodating staff.   parking great.   easy trip to the cliff house for dinner, and short walk to the beach- couldnt ask for more.
others have complained about the continental breakfast, not much to it,  but we just had the coffee and then headed out for a meal somewhere else.
review.positiveRemarks: Near the beach, nice easy walk.   Reasonable price for SF.
review.locationRemarks: Beach close,    Nice cafe next store or close to good restaurants.    Zoo across the street.

review.title: I think this hotel is a rip off
review.reviewText: Made reservations three weeks before showed up the hotel they had canceled our room, said they had no email address but we have the email confirming our reservation. Was a couple of reviews that said people had the same problem showing up no room. It was a sold-out weekend I think they sold the room for a higher price. But we traveled all the way from LA to end up with no room in town.
review.negativeRemarks: You should check into their business practice

review.title: Rip off
review.reviewText: Booked through expedia only to be told the room we had booked was not available unless we paid a premium. Letf with no choice but to pay. Never again would I use this hotel. They blamed the problem on expedia.

review.title: Great location, quiet, and comfortable.
review.reviewText: The location is ideal in regards to the beach and the zoo. The neighborhood is very quiet and peaceful. The parking is a little cramped but everything else about this location was perfect for what we were looking for. Coffee place, diner, and little market all within a couple of blocks as well. We were initially told that taxes were included by the expedia rep, however this was not the case so the two days stay ended up costing  more then we had expected but would definately stay at this hotel again. Well worth what was paid.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet location and friendly staff. The best sleep we have ever had at a hotel/motel setting. Very comfortable and the location was  perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: Communication regarding expedia reps pertaining to actual price. The parking is very cramped but not much can be done in regards to that.
review.locationRemarks: Zoo right across the street. The beach is down a couple of blocks with ample parking. Small diner for breakfast, small market, pizza place, atm's etc.

review.title: Stay away
review.reviewText: Very dirty looking, stains everywhere. There was a huge stain in the hallway, who knows what it was from. For the price I thought it would be a bit better and I wasnt expecting much. Our room only had hot water no cold from both the sink and shower. It was also the smallest room I've ever had. Also the cleaners shut the a/c off so the room was boiling when we got back.
review.positiveRemarks: The pizza place beside it is top notch!
review.negativeRemarks: New carpets
review.locationRemarks: To far away from mostly everything but the zoo

review.title: Older hotel 2 blocks from the Beach
review.reviewText:
Small room with a window which opened to see a wall. No view of anything at all! 
Very basic continental breakfast without any where to sit. You must take it to go back to your room. I don't recommend this hotel.

review.title: One night stand
review.reviewText: Okay for one night. Wouldn't do an extended stay. Rooms smelled of ancient cigarette smoke; bathrooms shoddily repaired.

review.title: Mconvenient to destination -
review.reviewText: Just acroos from the Zoo parking lot, ya just can't git closer dude!
review.positiveRemarks: location to Zoo and Great Highway.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast bar area ~ tables needed.
review.locationRemarks: Grosery store, Pizza restaurant, flowers at corner nursery store. Drive to great Highway and drive North to the Cliff House and Beach Chalet` ~~ Beach

review.title: Our stay in frisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was pleasant enough, but a long way from the action in a mainly residential area with virtually no restaurants shops etc in walking distance, lucky we had a car or we would have had to eat takeaway each night.
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: better hot breakfast
review.reviewText: should have nice hot breakfast such as eggs, ham, and pankakes

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Good experience, i recomend so better breakfast, itnis not confotable, you have to eat in the room or stand up
review.locationRemarks: There isnno things to do near

review.reviewText: The staff is very accommodating and helpful. The location is right across the street from the zoo which was one of our destinations. There's a wonderful old breakfast/lunch cafe about 2 blocks west of the hotel where we always eat. It dates from the 40's and has a wonderful menu, authentic food, and great service.

review.title: Wonderful relation quality-price in San Francisco!
review.reviewText:
This nice little hotel is near the beach, in a very quiet place, very close to a tram-metro line that leads you directly to the city center in about 15-20 minutes.
It is not a "luxury hotel", but the hotel staff is super-kind! They gave us information about the city and the main activities to do in the city. We got to Alcantraz thanks to the staff advice of when to buy the tickets! We got a flat tire and they helped us to solve the problem!
Nice breakfast to take to one's room: Juice, toast, marmalade, bread, coffee, tea and fruit.
To sum up: a very good place to stay in San Francisco (such a expensive city). We felt like at home! We would stay again if visiting San Francisco for a second time.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast, internet, location, the rooms are not luxus, but cozy...but the best was the staff!

review.reviewText: It was a nice place. Only 1 bad thing was the price was not the same when we got thier then what I was quoted on Expeda. Manager said I had to take it up with Expeda not him. So that was not good customer service.

review.title: Two Blocks From Ocean Beach
review.reviewText: This is a simple but very decent place to stay. Comfy beds, very easy in/outs -- sort of like home. Parking easy and free and very accessible to zoo and Golden Gate Bridge, Golden Gate Park, Ocean Beach, and more.
review.positiveRemarks: It is easy to get your car for free in/outs and there are many nice restaurants to go to. (watch out for Marnee Thai, undercooked seafood).
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast was juice, coffee, bread, whole fruit. OK but could include cereal and milk?
review.locationRemarks: Good pizza next door, great sandwich/pastry diner next door. Search for sand dollars 2 blocks down. Safe place. The Last Straw on Irving has gifts!

review.title: Nice Place to stay for Over night Trip..
review.reviewText: Headed to the City to spend the Day at the Zoo...Then enjoy ocean Beach so Close...Small Inn,Have to make sure you make reservation not much rooms, but cozy...I would go back!
review.positiveRemarks: Very Close to the SF Zoo&Beach...Great Pizza place next Door or if you want a Nice sit down eat Cafe...Walking Distance
review.negativeRemarks: The Morning Breakfast could have a little more variety...but Good for a Quick snack.
review.locationRemarks: Zoo, Beach, Shopping

review.title: Just ok
review.reviewText: Hotel is ok, however it is too far out of the city. Crap breakfast.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: This is our second time staying here, and really appreciate the great staff and nice rooms.

review.title: Over charged
review.reviewText: Overall the place was not that good was not expecting much but when I got overcharged for the room that I had reserved through expedia that was the cherry on the top. The Hotel did not honor the rate that I had made the reservations for which was $135 I was instead charged 135 first night then 199 the next 2 nights. Then room had a strange smell when I came in. Bed was pretty hard but expected a lower rent hotel did not expect to pay the price for a nicer hotel and get a cheaper hotel. Parking was horrible they maximize the spaces by making them to small for even a compact like my car basically had to park on top of the next guy and squeeze out the door. One positive was that I was never bothered by management or even talked to after check in or house keeping or anyone that was the positive.
review.negativeRemarks: Room smell and bed comfort, parking.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located right next to the zoo which is nice and overall in a quiet part of town near the beach. Location was just about perfect.

review.title: Convenient location for a SF visit, bargain rates
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this motel several times while visiting relatives in the SF area. The beach and zoo are very near. Hwy 1 North to the Presidio and Golden Gate Bridge and South to the airport is easy to reach - a straight drive along Sloat. Almost next door is George's Zoo where you can find snacks, beverages, deli sandwiches, newspapers, etc. A bit further away are choices for pizza, typical cafe fare, etc. Between this motel and Hwy 1 is a shopping center with supermarket, UPS store, USPS location, various shops and a few places to eat. For location you can hardly do better. The room rate is quite reasonable. Breakfast is juice, coffee or tea, fruit, toast or English muffin or sweet roll - more than adequate to get the day underway. Recently, the exterior has received a freshening up. From my most recent stay, I'd say the room itself needs attention - nothing major but several odds and ends. Parking below the motel is free.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, room rates, free parking, easy access to sites and roadways, microwave and small fridge in room.
review.negativeRemarks: The room I stayed in needed maintenance. The bathroom basin had no stopper. Caulking around the toilet & in the shower stall was unattractive.
review.locationRemarks: Sloat Ave runs directly from the beach to CA 1 and into St Francis Woods. This is an excellent location for going in almost any direction.

review.title: Okay if you need to be near SF State.
review.reviewText: Been to worse. Just needed a quick place for the night and this motel was near where I needed to be. Definitely could use a little sprucing up but like I said, it was adequate.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText:
we go there every year when we have an social event, nearby.
The room we got was really spacy and cosy.
Super clean , good staff.

review.title: A comfortable hotel in a relaxed SF location.
review.reviewText: This hotel was everything we expected it to be. It's a small place right across the street from the SF Zoo, and a couple short blocks to the beach! Another perk? Free parking! There are a few fun local places to pick up some food or coffee right next door. The building is currently under renovation, but it didn't really affect our stay. Finding the lobby was a bit of a challenge, and you can get lost with all the levels and stairs, but overall a comfortable place to stay... a real bargin considering the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Strange building, lackluster continental breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Next to SF Zoo, 2 blocks from the beach, an easy bike ride to GG park

review.title: Good location and reasonble price
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable and affordable with parking available. We will definitely stay there again, There was a very nice coffee place within walking distance and the beach is only 3 blocks away. Very nice. Location was good since we were going to the Stern Grove place.
review.negativeRemarks: No view. Our room looked at a wall. The "breakfast" was nothing much.
review.locationRemarks: Near the zoo and near the beach

review.title: Clean, courteous and convenient.
review.reviewText: Have stayed at the Days Inn multiple times in the past 4 years and have found the staff to be helpful and the rooms to be comfortable and more than adequate for my needs. The close proximity of two good eateries (next door) and the 1 1/2 block walk to the ocean make it a great place to stay and relax. I do not rent a car when I am there, so even the walk to a nearby mall is only 10 mins. The Sunset district does not have many motels/hotels but for a basic place to stay that is clean, has great staff and is near the ocean, this is the one to chose. Will continue to stay at the Days Inn for all my San Fran trips.

review.title: am not recommending it
review.reviewText: smells too dusty and the smoking room that we got smells too bad

review.title: Budget place by the beach
review.reviewText: Motel was surprisingly small for a Days Inn (only 2 floors, maybe 20 rooms?), but adequate for my needs, and I would likely return. Standard room size with a large, clean bathroom. Conveniently located across the street from the zoo and a couple of short blocks to the ocean and beach, and fairly close to the SFSU campus. Other than those rooms that look out over the street, the rest of the rooms had no scenic vistas whatsoevermy view was the wall of the building next door. Appeared to be the best motel in the immediate area, but it's still definitely a budget motel. Housekeeping and desk staff were friendly, though I never made any special requests and just saw them in the mornings. Offers a simple free breakfast of English muffins, toast, apples, oranges, juice, and coffee. Neighborhood seemed safe and family-friendly. A bus stop is across the street and a MUNI tram system stop around the corner about a block, so it was very easy to get into town. Not knowing the public transit system, I took a Super Shuttle van from the airport ($17), but returning home, I took the MUNI into town ($2) and picked up the BART train ($8) to the airport. Quiet at night, though there was some minor construction noise next door during the day. Dining options are extremely limiteda small local cafe with bar and a local pizzeria are in the block, but didn't appeal to me, so I ended up buying stuff from a mom and pop grocery next door. Didn't notice any other restaurants within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Dining and nightlife were non-existent.
review.locationRemarks: Right by the beach and the zoo.

review.title: Great if you do not need to be downtown.
review.reviewText: The couple that runs the hotel are absolutely wonderful. Very personable and generally interested in the well being of their guests. The room I had could use a bit of a touch up. Cracks in the door jambs, etc. Unfortunately the ventilation system cannot prevent some cigarette smoke smells from the rooms and so there is always a residual aroma of cigarettes. And it gets a bit stronger when somebody lights up some place in the hotel. It was tolerable however and won't prevent me from returning and rebooking with them. I am a SF native and come up to see my parents and kids who are launching their own careers in my hometown, so I don't need a touristy hotel. If you want to visit Union Square, ride a cable car,or see AT&T park and the Giants, this place may not be an ideal location as cross city traffic, and multiple MUNi metro transfers will eat up a lot of your time. Bring layered clothing. This location can get very windy and cold.
review.positiveRemarks: A wonderful couple runs this place.
review.negativeRemarks: Smokey, getting a little thread bare.
review.locationRemarks: Great location if you don't need to be downtown and like to explore West Portal, and other areas of the city.

review.title: My stay in SF
review.reviewText: Only the smoking rooms were available but we were told that they would vent the room and we would barelly smell the smoke in the room. Well they were wrong, we couldn't open the windows because there was a skew preventing the window from opening so basically all we could do was to turn on the vent in the room to try and circulate the air. My clothes and hair smelled like smoke all day. I had to wash everything I brought because everything reeked of the smell of cigarettes. So if you are a non-smoker and they tell you the smell isn't bad don't believe them.
review.negativeRemarks: I would say if I was able to get a non-smoking room I might rate this hotel a 3 just because of the location. The bathroom needed painting and repair.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to SF State, park and ocean.

review.title: good location to San Francisco State.
review.reviewText: Good location to San Francisco State. Not great, but not bad. You get what you pay for.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to the SF zoo. With two or three blocks away, you can walk to the beach. It's also close to the public transportation L line. I booked this hotel for my parents and they like it.

review.title: Only good thing is the location
review.reviewText: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. The staff were very unaccommodating, we had a bed cover that had a cigarette burn on it, the shower had zero pressure and the shower head was broken. Will not be staying there again

review.title: Days Inn - SFO
review.reviewText: I called the motel twice (on two different days) to let them know we were checking in late. They were very accomodating and even remembered me (by name!)
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient. If you are heading to Pacifica, Golden Gate, and downtown San Francisco, this is a good place to stay.

review.title: Great location!!!. Just steps from the beach!!!
review.reviewText: They were great at the front desk and were able to check me in late a night.

review.title: Great hotel for everyone.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an excellent location - one block from the ocean, next door to a great pizza place and an incredible cafe and a short walk to a mall. If staying downtown is not your bag, this place is great. The price is certainly good and the owners are really nice people. No frills, but a clean place to stay with comfortable beds. Have stayed here many times and will continue to come back.

review.title: OK property in a good location
review.reviewText: Straight down the middle 3/OK rating. Booked the hotel due to the proximity to SFSU for an orientation visit and it was OK for that. Room had a mini-fridge & microwave but was otherwise small/cramped for three people. Complimentary breakfast was limited continental breakfast -- breads, juice, coffee, some fruit. I was not disappointed because I booked the property for it's location and was only in the room to sleep. If just OK is not suitable for you, try another place. If you're more into what's happening outside the room (i.e. the reason in the area that you're visiting for) and don't mind a basic room, then you'll be fine.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, close to Zoo & SFSU
review.negativeRemarks: Small, basic rooms
review.locationRemarks: A couple of blocks off the ocean on Sloat at the north edge of the Zoo

review.title: Never Again in a Days Inn...
review.reviewText: The room "looked" fine, typical two double bed room. At first the room smelled like disinfectant, but as the minutes ticked by the room started to smell like urine. The bottom of the shower curtain was spotted in black mold. The TV and lights did not work in the room - the clerk discovered that the batteries were dead in the remote control and that the light sockets were too loose to hold the light plugs. The next morning - unfortunately/fortunately we had to stay one night - I complained to the manager and he said he did not know anything about the urine odor, maybe the carpets need cleaning (how about replacing?), but that the shower curtain was clean but they can not get the stain(s) out. Suffice it to say I will never stay at a Days Inn again!

review.title: our stay at Days Inn
review.reviewText: very clean and the clerk at the desk ws cporteous and kind. Check in was easy and without problems.

review.title: Great potential to be a really nice place.
review.reviewText: Pleasant staff. After initialing for $250 penalty for smoking (which I do not) in room, I went to the room to find the bathroom stinking of cig smoke. Apparently due to the way the vents are connected to smoking allowed rooms. Fixed with a plug-in air freshener. Great looking room, but the tub enclosure looked like it was done by an unqualified relative of the owner. Poorest continental breakfast I've ever seen. But that was not important to me, but might be to a family.
review.negativeRemarks: Smell of smoking in non-smoking bathroom
review.locationRemarks: great if you're going to the zoo or visiting kids at SFSU

review.title: A Great Place To Stay
review.reviewText: The staff were pleasant and made us feel very welcome. They were very helfpul with information about places to eat and public transport. Thankyou to all staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great location next to Muni transport for ease of getting around.

review.title: OK but not worth the price.
review.reviewText: Parking is dreadful. Very hard to park an F250 truck. I was told it had a view of the beach but all I saw was a parking garage. Room is small and you have to squeeze around furniture to go around the bed. I had to unplug the refrigerator because it was too noisy disturbing my sleep. The continental breakfast was lacking and served in the hallway. I can say, however, that the staff is very nice and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is dreadful if you have larger than a compact car.
review.locationRemarks: OK but not close to good restaurants.

review.title: DId the J O B !
review.reviewText: Nothing special with the hotel but the location was extremely convienient.
review.negativeRemarks: A little street noise and inside parking was tight.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location to the Zoo and beach.

review.title: After Zoo
review.reviewText: If you know you will be tired after the zoo, especailly with small chidlren this is a decent place to stay. Walking distance from zoo and good returants walking distance or quick drive.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This is not a fancy place to stay BUT the folks who own it are wonderful and very accomodating, the proximity to the ocean cannot be beat, the two restaurants within feet of the motel are great and the shopping mall nearby is more than adequate. The bus service in San Fran is exceptional and for your dollar there are few places that can compare to this one. Have stayed at the Days Inn many times to visit with a family member nearby and hope to stay again soon.

review.title: Best place to stay for this area of San Fran
review.reviewText:
In this quiet part of the city, the Days Inn was a perfect place for me to stay - there is a shopping mall only a 10 minute walk away with a grocery store, etc - hotel has fridges and microwaves, so eating out is not your only option. Is just a block from the beach if that is what you like. Both the restaurants next to the hotel are great - one good thin-crust pizza place and the other a sandwich shop/bakery with great eats. Especially during the off-season this is a good deal for your money - on-season, still under what you would pay downtown. Not that far out of the way to deter you and your rental car from going around the city and returning to this relaxing neighborhood for a good night's sleep.
The bed was comfortable and the staff and owners kind-hearted - have stayed with them numerous times and they are good folks.

review.title: Happy
review.reviewText: We were extremely pleased with the room assigned dto us..

review.title: It was just, OK
review.reviewText: I'm not a picky person but this place was not bad if you're looking just for a place to sleep. I didnt feel to comfortable sleeping there but for the price I did expect a little more cleanliness. The walls had several stains on them and these are things that I am never picky about, which was a complete turn off. Also the soap,body lotion and shampoo all are in a dispenser, which is really good if you're trying to cut cost but does not feel inviting. Lastly, this was the first place ever in my time of traveling that we were not allowed to stay past check out. However, for location it is great. Near many bus lines as well as Union St which has alot of good dining.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText:
The room was comfortable, spacious, and more than adequately furnished. There was a refrigerator and microwave. The king-size bed was comfortable. The location was very convenient for us on the west side of the city, walking distance to the ocean and the zoo, with basement parking. The price was right!
Negatives: Our window looked out directly on the interior parking lot. There was a car parked right on the other side of the glass.
And the breakfast was awful. It was laid out in a hallway, with nice, fresh English muffins and white bread for toasting. But there were no plates or napkins to put your toast on! Were we supposed to just juggle it? I ended up carrying my muffin in the plastic ice bucket from my room. There was only artificial butter, and the grocery store pastries were moldy. There were a few bits of fresh fruit, and apple juice from a dispenser, but the OJ was gone. There was a coffee dispenser, and hot water, but no tea bags. I was disappointed.
Otherwise, the accommodations were more than adequate.

review.title: Would never go back to this hotel
review.reviewText: We would never go back to this hotel. The bed was horrible. You could feel the springs. Very uncomfortable. The shower was not working properly. The room overall looked dirty. We couldn't wait to get out of there.

review.title: TERRIBLE SERVICE & CONDITION
review.reviewText: I HAD MEDICAL TESTS @ V.A. HOSPITOL. WE WENT TO OUR ROOM & THE SMELL WAS TERRIBLE. THERE WAS A MACHINE RUNNING IN THE ROOM FOR THE SMELL BUT IT DID'NT WORK. THE TOILET SEAT WAS BROKEN & THE AC DID NOT WORK. I COMPLAINED, BUT SUDDENLY THE MANAGER COULD NOT SPEAK ENGLISH. THEY REFUSED TO CHANGE ROOMS, AND AFTER A POINT I FELT THEY WERE DISCRIMINATING AGAINST BECAUSE I WAS A VETERAN. GREAT LOCATION, TERRIBLE SERVICE.

review.title: Reasonable price for San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and well kept. It even provided a limited continental breakfast for the very reasonable price. It had free parking as well. It was close to the beach and the zoo. Restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Very nice for an overnighter. Across street from zoo and beach.
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and quiet. The coffee pot in the room didn't work but there was a very nice coffee house next door. Parking was free, which is unusual in SF. We would go back again.

review.title: Not as pictured or described
review.reviewText: This hotel was terrible. When checking in, we were sent to the wrong room. When we told the attendant that there was no such room, he sent us to an outside room. Upon entering the room, we were almost knocked over by the smell of cigarettes and urine. This was supposed to be the non smoking room. Parking was a nightmare, very tight. We will definately never stay there again.

review.title: eh
review.reviewText:
wanted two queen beds, had only a king. asked for a rollaway, had none. asked for extra blanket , pillows, had none.

not terrible, just not thrilled.

review.title: Standard hotel for that price, nothing spectacular
review.reviewText:
Standard hotel, nothing spectacular; if you want inexpensive, this is the place, but you get what you pay for. Breakfast consist of bread, store-bought danishes, bad coffee. Luckily there's a cafe close by that offers good food and wi-fi.

Good location though, if you want to visit the zoo. Beach is about a 5-6 minute walk, not "across the street" as they claim.

review.title: Great price for San Francisco
review.reviewText: It isn't a five star hotel, but perfect for the amount of time we spent in the room. My grandson (7 yrs old)and I take an annual road trip. This hotel is across the street from the zoo and a couple of blocks from the ocean. A pizza parlor and a small store next door. Room incluces a frig and microwave - perfect. I hate driving in SF, but with a gps it is conveniently located to the science center, Exploratorium and the wharf/aquarium. We spent 4 busy days without a hitch. I would definitely stay there again. Parking was a little cramped, but it was free. And free internet. A great deal for San Francisco.

review.title: Great SF hotel for the Zoo/GG Park/Beach
review.reviewText:
In a great spot for the zoo (right across the street). Golden Gate Park is within biking distance as is Sutro heights. And Ocean beach is a block away.

Free Parking albeit a bit cramped.

Good Breakfast right down the street (Johns Ocean Beach Cafe)
Other than that and the sandwich place, pizzeria next door and grocery deli there is not many restaurants in the near vicinity.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Was a great place to stay if you are planing on going to the san fran zoo. The coffee shop two doors down is a great place to stop in and get a coffee or a sandwich. They even have some beers on tap. Was very quiet at night and cool in the mornings. I will stay here again.

review.title: ok for one night
review.reviewText: It was a nice hotel, but i expected it to be a little nicer for what i paid.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Main negative is there is very limited parking.

review.title: Clean hotel close to the Pacific Ocean
review.reviewText: This location was perfect for us. It was nice to be away from the city yet close enough to be able to get there in 20-25 min. Parking was free (unheard of in the city). We did not use the "breakfast" which was coffee, apples, and packaged sweet roll- but really enjoyed the Java Beach Cafe on the corner. The room was clean and spacious and just a short walk to the Pacific Ocean. Quiet and clean. We will be staying again.

review.title: OK for a night or two, great price.
review.reviewText: Hotel is right across from the SF Zoo, street is a little busy, but much better than Downtown or Wharf. Our room was large and very clean, nice bathroom. Parking was FREE, an amazing thing in the City. Lobby and "breakfast" is pretty much non-existant. I'd stay here again for an overnight trip.

review.title: worn & overworked
review.reviewText: It's OK. Clean, but worn out and overworked. The weekend desk clerk is apparently on duty continuously from Friday night through Monday morning--it took almost an hour to wake him up when I arrived in the middle of the night Saturday (although I called ahead and said I would). The "free continental breakfast" is an apple and a vending machine pastry.

review.title: Very large nice room
review.reviewText: Very clean Large room.
